The 'Republic of Korea Navy' ('ROKN'; ; Hanja: å¤§éæ°å æµ·è»; Revised Romanization:
Daehanminguk Haegun), also known as the 'ROK Navy', is the naval warfare service
branch of the South Korean armed forces, responsible for conducting naval
operations and amphibious landing operations. The ROK Navy includes
the Republic of Korea Marine Corps, which is a quasi-autonomous
organization. The ROK Navy is the oldest branch of the South Korean
armed forces, and celebrated its 65th anniversary in 2010.

Since the Korean War, the ROK Navy concentrated its efforts to build naval
forces to counteract the North Korean navy, which has littoral naval
capabilities. As South Korea's economy grew, the ROK Navy was able to build
larger and better equipped fleets to deter aggression, to protect national
maritime rights and to support the nation's foreign
policies. [http://www.navy.mil.kr/about/oceannavy/oceannavy_1.jsp "í´êµ°ì ì­í "].
Republic of Korea Navy Official Website . Retrieved March 8, 2007.
As a part of its mission, the ROK Navy has engaged in several peacekeeping
operations since the turn of the 21st century. [http:-
//www.mnd.go.kr/news/mndNews/content.jsp?enewsFlag=mnd&section=p_sec_3&enewsId=-
155119621 "í´êµ°ìì ì¬ë ¹ë¶ ì°½ì¤ 54ì£¼ë..ì´ì ì ì¤ë ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ë¯¸ë"]. Ministry of National Defense
Official Website . Retrieved March 4, 2007.

The ROK Navy has about 68,000 regular personnel including 27,000 Republic of
Korea Marines (as of 2010). There are about 170 commissioned ships (with a total
displacement of about 181,000
tons [http://www.mod.go.jp/e/publ/w_paper/2011.html "Defense of Japan
2011"]. Ministry of Defense Official Website . Retrieved September 23,
2011. ) in the ROK Navy, including some 20 destroyers and frigates, 12
submarines, 100 corvettes and fast attack craft as of 2011. The naval aviation
force consists of about 70 fixed-wing and rotary-wing aircraft. The ROK Marine
Corps has about 400 tracked vehicles including self-propelled artillery.

The ROK Navy aims to become a blue-water navy by 2020. [http://www.navy.mil-
.kr/about/oceannavy/oceannavy_5.jsphttp://navy.mil.kr/sub_guide/navy_about.jsp?-
menu=6&smenu=1 "í´êµ°ì ë¯¸ë"]. Republic of Korea Navy Official Website .
Retrieved September 24, 2011. [http://thediplomat.com/2010/11/18/south-koreas-blue-water-
ambitions/ "South Koreaâs Blue-water Ambitions"]. The Diplomat .
Retrieved June 21, 2012.
headings: Naval engagements of the ROK Navy
